metadata.job_title: Senior Data Engineer – Commerce Data Pipelines

seniority_level.evidence: Job title includes "Senior Data Engineer"; senior title overrides the 3+ years experience requirement.

job_family.evidence: Title and responsibilities focus on ETL pipelines, data modeling, and data warehouse technologies.

sub_specialty.evidence: Responsibilities emphasize ETL pipeline design, Airflow orchestration, and data warehouse platforms (Snowflake, Redshift) typical of batch processing.

leadership_expectation.evidence: No mention of people‑management duties or direct reports; role is focused on technical delivery and collaboration.

primary_cloud.evidence: Redshift is an AWS‑native data warehouse; Snowflake can run on AWS and is commonly used there. No other cloud providers are mentioned.

secondary_clouds.evidence: Only AWS‑related services (Redshift) are referenced; no Azure, GCP, or other clouds appear in the posting.

processing_paradigm.evidence: Job description centers on ETL pipeline creation, Airflow orchestration, and data warehouse loading – all batch‑oriented activities.

orchestrator_category.evidence: Airflow is explicitly listed as a required ETL orchestration tool.

storage_layer.evidence: Snowflake and Redshift are both data‑warehouse platforms; no lake‑specific storage is mentioned.

remote_restriction.evidence: Location restriction lists US cities (Seattle, Santa Monica, NYC) and the hybrid model requires onsite presence four days a week.

timezone_focus.evidence: All listed locations are within the Americas (US West and East coasts).

relocation_required.evidence: The posting does not mention a relocation package or requirement; candidates must simply be able to work onsite in the listed US cities.

h1b_friendly.evidence: ext_visa_sponsorship_stated = "will_not_sponsor"; H‑1B sponsorship is explicitly excluded.

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: Work authorization text excludes OPT and CPT.

citizenship_required.evidence: Accepts GC, US citizens, and any valid EADs (except OPT/CPT/H‑1B); no citizenship‑only clause.

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Rate line states "Up to $92.5/hr on W2" and explicitly says no C2C or 1099.

benefits_level.evidence: ext_benefits_mentioned array is empty; no benefits are described in the posting.

growth_path_clarity.evidence: The posting contains no language about career ladders, promotion tracks, or growth opportunities.

mentorship_signals.evidence: No reference to mentorship programs, assigned mentors, or learning from senior staff.

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No statements about promotion, advancement, or moving to higher titles.

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: The job description does not discuss internal transfers or lateral moves within the company.

career_tracks_available.evidence: No mention of IC, management, specialist, or architect tracks.

requirement_strictness.evidence: A clear set of must‑have hard skills is listed, with only one nice‑to‑have skill (Nifi), indicating a balanced requirement level.

scope_definition.evidence: Responsibilities are narrowly focused on data engineering tasks (ETL, modeling, quality, performance).

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: The required skill set (SQL, Python/PySpark, Airflow, Snowflake/Redshift) aligns with a senior data‑engineer role; 3+ years is modest but not unrealistic.
